snippet: Amichai Lau-Lavie, a rabbinical student, is leading an effort at Lab/Shul, which meets in Manhattan, to make worship more relevant to people with weak ties to traditional institutions.
abstract: Rabbinical student Amichai Lau-Lavie is leading effort to make worship more relevant to people with busy schedules and weak ties to traditional institutions; Lau-Lavie is carrying out mission via Lab/Shul, pop-up Synagogue that is open to those of all religious faiths, or no faith at all.
lead_paragraph: Amichai Lau-Lavie, a rabbinical student, is leading an effort at Lab/Shul, which meets in Manhattan, to make worship more relevant to people with weak ties to traditional institutions.

headline.seo: Lab/Shul Is an Experimental Jewish Gathering Still in Its Beta Phase
